parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. The post does not refer to any specific parliamentary candidate by name, surname, or any other clear identifier.  It discusses the conflict in Ukraine, a general geopolitical issue, not tied to any specific candidate or party.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a paid advertisement on Facebook, a public platform, and its content is clearly intended to reach a wide audience, not just a specific individual or small group.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>False. The objective of the post is to inform the public about the ongoing conflict in Ukraine and its international implications. There is no explicit or implicit attempt to influence voters' choices in the parliamentary elections. The content is primarily news-related, not campaign-related.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>True. The post presents itself as a news summary, providing information on international events. The style and content align with journalistic standards, aiming to inform rather than persuade.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>Not applicable. The post does not express personal opinions; it presents factual information about the Ukraine conflict.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>497160306678863</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, focusing on the Ukraine conflict, does not constitute electoral propaganda.  While it's a paid advertisement on a public platform, its content is purely journalistic in nature, providing a news summary. It does not mention any parliamentary candidates, parties, or attempt to influence voting behavior. The post's objective is to inform, not to advocate for a particular candidate or party in the parliamentary elections.  The timing of the post, even if after the official campaign period, is irrelevant because the content itself is not electoral propaganda.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>Strategic Media Team srl</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
